_description: ‘De Terminis vsure’, a poem dealing with the several forms of usury — twelve irregular stanzas in couplets

BLEge2810.First Lines: Okure þrow crafte of okerrersSchowis hit on mony manere…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …Now haf I schend ȝe[   ]þe cawris in oþ[  ]
BLEge2810.Note: Ends of last lines damaged by damp; ends “Explicit.”
BLEge2810.Editions:
Bowers,  Robert Hood. 
             “A Middle English Mnemonic Poem on Usury.” 
             Mediaeval Studies
         17 (1955): 226-32: 230-2.
